newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria lev ends flat to mark, eases vs dollar.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria lev ends flat to mark, eases vs dollar.

text.p: The Bulgarian lev closed at 994.60-995.40 per mark, in a narrower spread from the opening's 994.50-995.50, after a calm domestic interbank trade as foreign currency supply outweighed demand, dealers said.
* The central bank was seen as a main foreign currency buyer amid the seasonally low demand from fuel and energy importers.

* Under the currency board system, introduced on July 1, the Bulgarian National Bank pledged to buy and sell unlimited volumes of marks, the anchor currency, at a bid price of 995 levs and an ask of 1,000.
* The lev eased to 1,784-1,787 per dollar from the morning's 1,780-1,782 as traders adjusted levels to the local lev/mark interbank exchange rate and the mark/dollar cross on international markets.
